qas.question: How many political municipalities has the city of Montevideo been divided into as of 2010?
What is the head of each Municipio called?
Who elects the mayor of the political municipalities?

answers.text: the citizens registered in the constituency

context: As of 2010[update], the city of Montevideo has been divided into <a0_0>8<a0_0/> political municipalities (Municipios), referred to with the letters from A to G, including CH, each presided over by a mayor elected by <a2_0>the citizens registered in the constituency<a2_0/>. This division, according to the Municipality of Montevideo, "aims to advance political and administrative decentralization in the department of Montevideo, with the aim of deepening the democratic participation of citizens in governance." The head of each Municipio is called <a1_0>an alcalde<a1_0/> or (if female) alcaldesa.
